posts.name: Anon
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone! Maybe it seems a rubbish thing but for me it’s a serious stuffs.

yesterday around afternoon i got a call from a friend while he went to a swimming pool with his family. What he said got me confusing at first but when he mentioned every thing our friends start to fear to use the signal app.

here’s what happened: While having a good time with his family he recieved the call from the nearby police station or we can say the Main branch of the police Station in our City. They didn’t tell me why but called him to come to the police station with phone(complusory). He didn’t know what happened but we went because he didn’t do anything wrong. When he arrived, the police officer mentioned “Who gave you the permission to use the Signal? Do you have contacts with some terr*****? or you are a drug dealers?” and many thing which was confusing for him because we only uses Signal because of the friend group we had to share our stuffs. (You know boys stuffs).

Except the Group there was a User in his signal chat who is our friend too he turned off the number visibility for everyone and only his username was visible but what happened after taking the Username of the user police directly called him which is only possible when the Signal shares the Data with the Government or there affiliates which i believe is against the Policy of Signal and also not to mentioned the Person didn’t disclose the name of the user in his chat infront of thr Police as he said it’s his private thing weather the user is Girl or Boy Police don’t have to know that.

But shockingly they took the username and after like 10 minutes he also came to the Police station because they called him but how???

Is Signal Really safe? Is it just a Joke what Signal mentions Privacy???

This is real stuffs and other folks are getting called to the Police station and Police are deleting there account and banning them to use the Signal again.

Because of the Signal found in my friends phone Police also forcefully installed a Spyware in my friends phone and told him not to delete the App or try to FOrmat the phone. What the hell is this??? Signal I need answer.

It seems that you live in a very authoritarian country, so sorry to hear that. Signal can indeed give a user’s phone number to the police, because this number is what identifies the account. However, they will only provide this and your registration date and last connection date

Signal Messenger

Government Communication

When legally forced to provide information to government or law enforcement agencies, we'll disclose the transcripts of that communication here.

This would require official requests to signal though, which the police couldn’t have done in such a short amount of time, so it is likely that they acquired the number by other means. Is it possible that they got it from your phone’s contacts for example?

I can’t give any legal advice, but if using signal is considered illegal in your country, you might not want to. If phone numbers don’t require an ID to get them, then you could get a number that isn’t associated with your name, use that number for a signal account and then not react if police or anyone else calls.

The first option: they got his number from phone’s contact book.
The second option: if I remember correctly, the client app still shows number if someone started conversation first and then enabled number privacy. So if this person contacted your friend for the first time before Signal got phone number privacy, or first contacted and turned off number visibility later, your friend’s client app wouldn’t “forget” this person number.

thereacher:

Because of the Signal found in my friends phone Police also forcefully installed a Spyware in my friends phone and told him not to delete the App or try to FOrmat the phone. What the hell is this???

This is game over. I wouldn’t trust this device even formatted now. As it seems you live in really authoritarian country, I would recommend complying and not delete this spyware in any way. The best course here would be buying a new phone for any meaningful conversations, while still using the tapped device enough, not to give police reason thinking he’s now using another phone.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
in addition to that, i’d like to add that if someone in a group chat is compromised, then there’s nothing Signal can do about your info leaking to them via that person.

Can Signal protect against communicating with adversaries? Will username protect phone number in this case?

If I’m chatting with someone who wants undesirable things for me, even the best software won’t prevent me from saying “hi I’m Jane” and revealing my identity. And then, if that adversary has a government behind them, even the best software won’t prevent them from arresting me and getting me to hand over the phone. (Honestly, in that scenario they don’t even need to chat with you on Signal, they can just arrest you and get you to hand over your phone.)

thereacher:

Except the Group there was a User in his signal chat who is our friend too he turned off the number visibility for everyone and only his username was visible but what happened after taking the Username of the user police directly called him which is only possible when the Signal shares the Data with the Government or there affiliates which i believe is against the Policy of Signal and also not to mentioned the Person didn’t disclose the name of the user in his chat infront of thr Police as he said it’s his private thing weather the user is Girl or Boy Police don’t have to know that.

But shockingly they took the username and after like 10 minutes he also came to the Police station because they called him but how???

the most important question here is not if they turned off visibility, but discoverability. i.e were you able to find them using your phone contacts or their phone number, or did they go out of their way to ensure it can’t happen (with the discoverability setting)?
i assume since it’s a friends chat that you did what normal people do, and didn’t, which unfortunately makes it not too hard to realise you use Signal.
what seems to have happened in this scenario is that the police got the user’s info via one person arrested, then crossed it with other info. if i’m police, i arrest Alice and i see in her phone that she has a chat with Bob. i have a suspicion who that Bob is, so i check in another database and find Bob’s phone number. i then open my Signal app and enter Bob’s number, and indeed, he has a Signal account. i then proceed to arrest Bob, rinse and repeat.

Can Signal protect against communicating with adversaries? Will username protect phone number in this case? General Discussion
No app can save you from chatting with an adversary. Signal definitely can’t.

if Signal is illegal in your country, then you need to make sure you don’t only disable phone number discoverability, but that you have no identifiable info on your profile, and also that none of my contacts add in that info with the nickname feature.
even if Bob turned off discoverability and made his profile be a single-letter B with a black profile picture, if Alice uses the nickname feature and writes “Bob Bobson” on the profile, then gets arrested, then police know with high likelihood Bob Bobson uses the app. not much Signal can do about it.
opsec is always reliant on the weakest link in the chain.

link_counts.title: Can Signal protect against communicating with adversaries? Will username protect phone number in this case?

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: also general life advice: if you’re ever arrested, the only words you should ever say to the police are “i want a lawyer”. (got that said to me even by an actual lawyer.)

Absolutely, that is definitely true in countries with a functioning justice system. However, if one lives in a country where you can be compelled to unlock your phone, keep spyware and not use Signal, then they might not send you a lawyer…

Still doesn’t hurt to ask. Even in countries where unlocking your phone is not legally required, police can still lie to you and say that it is, a lawyer would know these details and could tell you what information/access you are and aren’t required to provide.
What is the spyware app?

that lawyer option does not sound good option on totalitarian regimes, is u.s. one at the moment !

assuming story true, i think phone number or numbers have been leaked somehow. possible spyware. is it possible that phone number has been used by other person in the past, i mean current user or users have new numbers.

i say here, sometimes is more important to secure underlying system than getting perfect messaging app. like, android, ios, windows, linux, and so on.

few years ago i didn’t thing “pegasus” or similar was serious threat, i have changed my mind little bit. there was a small research, which said that roughly 2% devices were infected with “pegasus”. not a serious threat, but big enough that it is possible that ordinary person gets one. if device is infected with pegasus, spy can snoop almost everything from device.

short version: if device has pegasus or similar malware, best course of action is to destroy device and getting new one. (for reasons mentioned in here, do not do immediately.)

zetabeta:

pegasus

Fun fact: As far as we know, Signal was not readable to Pegasus and in response to the media coverage, they included code to crash it when it tries to read Signal.

desert_nip:

Sorry, this post came from a source which I can not find anymore, so please consider it to be false unless someone finds a source.

desert_nip:

Signal was not readable to Pegasus and in response to the media coverage

That’s not true, Pegaus can access anything on the device, and thus also Signal data.

desert_nip:

they included code to crash it when it tries to read Signal

WTF? Source?

desert_nip:
zetabeta:

pegasus

Fun fact: As far as we know, Signal was not readable to Pegasus and in response to the media coverage, they included code to crash it when it tries to read Signal.

signal may have preventive measures against pegasus. but pegasus is a root level infection, so in theory pegasus has more control. even that, if device is infected, user may have bigger issues than thinking signal’s countermeasures.

pegasus is something we know, i think there is similar malware we do not know, but being as bad or worse.

Yes, Pegasus can absolutely still access content indirectly via screenshots or other measures.

Sorry, my previous post came from a source which I can not find anymore, so please consider it to be false unless someone finds a source.

zetabeta:

pegasus is something we know, i think there is similar malware we do not know, but being as bad or worse.

Exactly. Pegasus just got enough publicity to be known even by ordinary people. And for each such tool we know of, there are probably 20 others largely unknown outside intelligence/law enforcement circles but with similar capabilities.

For example this:

posts.cooked: But the thing about Signal adding a boobytrapped file was 99.999999% a joke.

posts.name: kara
posts.cooked: I agree, but this could still be the origin of the idea. At least it’s the most similar thing about Signal I have heard of.

Yes, I don’t think I saw that particular article, but possibly some other article where it was misconstrued into something else. Thank you for finding this though, I was wondering where the initial idea came from, this was probably it.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
DirkPitt1:

if I remember correctly, the client app still shows number if someone started conversation first and then enabled number privacy. So if this person contacted your friend for the first time before Signal got phone number privacy, or first contacted and turned off number visibility later, your friend’s client app wouldn’t “forget” this person number.

The client purges the number unless it doesn’t have another valid identifier, since it cannot confirm it has ownership of the account when discoverability is disabled.

QuickBanana:

But the thing about Signal adding a boobytrapped file was 99.999999% a joke.

Or perhaps related to the reports on this forum when users find contacts having numbers that are not recognized.
